Author: Confucius
QuoteNote: He who learns but does not think, is lost. He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.

Author: Jim Rohn
QuoteNote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.

Author: Micheal Sokoya
QuoteNote: You were born to make an impact.

Author: FrankLin D. Roosevelt
QuoteNote: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.

Author: Margaret Thatcher
QuoteNote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it

Author: Thomas Jefferson
QuoteNote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.

Author: Chris Grosser
QuoteNote: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
QuoteNote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

Author: Winston Churchill
QuoteNote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

Author: Sam Levenson
QuoteNote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

Author: Oscar Wilde
QuoteNote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

Author: Oscar Wilde
QuoteNote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

Author: Oscar Wilde
QuoteNote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
QuoteNote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

Author: Aristotle
QuoteNote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
QuoteNote: The only journey is the one within.

Author: Jean de La Bruyère
QuoteNote: Out of difficulties grow miracles.

Author: Mary Anne Radmacher
QuoteNote: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.

Author: Japanese Proverb
QuoteNote: Fall seven times, stand up eight.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
QuoteNote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.

Author: Confucius
QuoteNote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
QuoteNote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
QuoteNote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

Author: Robert Frost
QuoteNote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.

Author: Aristotle
QuoteNote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
QuoteNote: Where there is love there is life.

Author: William Shakespeare
QuoteNote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

Author: David Viscott
QuoteNote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
QuoteNote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.

Author: Audrey HepburnJohann Wolfgang von Goethe
QuoteNote: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
QuoteNote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful.

Author: William James
QuoteNote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

Author: Steve Jobs
QuoteNote: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.

Author: Pablo Picasso
QuoteNote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.

Author: Maya Angelou
QuoteNote: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.

Author: Mother Teresa
QuoteNote: Peace begins with a smile.

Author: Thich Nhat Hanh
QuoteNote: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.

Author: Dalai Lama
QuoteNote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
QuoteNote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

Author: Anne Lamott
QuoteNote: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.

Author: Henri Matisse
QuoteNote: Creativity takes courage.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
QuoteNote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.

Author: Maya Angelou
QuoteNote: You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.

Author: Pablo Picasso
QuoteNote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

Author: Steve Jobs
QuoteNote: Stay hungry, stay foolish.

Author: Walt Whitman
QuoteNote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.

Author: Winston Churchill
QuoteNote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.

Author: David Bailey
QuoteNote: A positive attitude can really make dreams come true.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
QuoteNote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

Author: Aristotle
QuoteNote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.

Author: Helen Keller
QuoteNote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

Author: Bertrand Russell
QuoteNote: Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
QuoteNote: Life isn’t about finding yourself. It’s about creating yourself.

Author: William Wallace
QuoteNote: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
QuoteNote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
